questions.question_text: How is CAPWAP data traffic encapsulated when running an Over the Top WLAN in a Cisco SD-Access wireless environment?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. What does the Python code accomplish?

choices.B: It generates a status code of 403 because the type is incorrect.
choices.D: It returns data in JSON-RPC format.
choices.A: It configures interface e1/32 to be in an admin down state
choices.C: It configures interface e1/32 to be in an err-disable state.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
I think its A, because of the "input" key. And also I do not see any mistake in this that would cause an error.

Selected Answer: A
This code sends a CLI command to the Cisco switch to shut down interface e1/32 via its NX-API.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which action must be performed to allow RESTCONF access to the device?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
RESTCONF runs over HTTPS. The following commands must be enabled to support RESTCONF over port 443:

ip http secure-server

https://developer.cisco.com/docs/ios-xe/#!enabling-restconf-on-ios-xe/authentication

Hence D

comments.content: nvm. nginx is https related process.
Ok, but where does it say HTTPS not enabled?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
SSH - required for NETCONF
HTTPS - required for RSTCONF

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Mainframe + Host are Hardware Devices and they do not EMULATE but rather EXECUTE.

Virtual Machine is the only "EMULATION" capable thing in the list.

A container is a software wrapper that allows programs to run inside it, but itself it still needs to be executed and not emulated.

Answer: C Virtual Machine is my choice here.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
voting. provided answer is correct
Virtual machine is the correct answer
